all.title: Why template arrays?
all.author: slavcoder
content: This is an experiment which I believe may be useful in some JavaScript libraries or maybe even for a simple templates like in this example.
Even though this is more difficult to use on the begining (those commas gonna kill me some day), I think it gives more flexibility and clarity than template strings.

all.title: Advanteges of template arrays
all.author: slavcoder
content: "Using arrays to render html? Is there a doctor in this file?"

you can use them inside .json file (this article is an example of it) and still use var and attr to change parts of its content and attributes of elements just before render html (which is a better way if you care about performance than changing it by DOM queries)
you can choose to order them from lightest to darkest and vice verse
each element have random background color
each element have font color black or white (depends on background color)
you can check in console rendering time (it depends on your machine obviously and can be much faster without this ridiculous color calculations i made)
easy to use - no functions, template array is ready to use after define
easy to learn, it is basicly html inside arrays
this is an example paragraphs with links inside:

And of course, this is a simple demostration - it can be done by template strings as well, but I think that template arrays have more possiblities. I'm working on JS library using this concept for simple render and manipalate DOM - nothing special (lawa, version 1.0.0 still not released).
